ðŸ’¡ yt-dlp-mcp | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Integrating video and audio content with Large Language Models and AI agents for tasks such as information retrieval, content analysis, and automated workflows.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Search & Discovery (YouTube search with pagination) â€¢ Metadata Extraction (video and channel details) â€¢ Transcript & Subtitles (download and generate transcripts) â€¢ Video Downloads (resolution control, trimming)
ðŸ“– Summary: The yt-dlp-mcp repository provides a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that acts as a bridge between video and audio content from platforms like YouTube and Large Language Models. It leverages yt-dlp to enable AI agents to search, extract metadata, download content, and generate transcripts from video and audio sources using natural language commands.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ BubbleLab | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automating workflows with full control, transparency, and type safety, enabling developers to own, debug, and deploy workflows anywhere.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Prompt to Workflow (AI-assisted workflow generation) â€¢ Full Observability (execution tracing, logs, token usage, performance metrics) â€¢ Import from n8n (workflow migration)
ðŸ“– Summary: Bubble Lab is an open-source workflow automation platform designed for developers. It offers full observability, allowing users to monitor execution, track token usage, and debug workflows. A key feature is the ability to export workflows as clean, production-ready TypeScript code, providing control and portability.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ posterizarr | PowerShell
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automated generation of textless posters for media libraries.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ User-Friendly Web UI â€¢ Multiple Media Servers (Plex, Jellyfin, Emby) â€¢ Kometa Integration â€¢ Smart Integration (Tautulli, Sonarr, Radarr)
ðŸ“– Summary: Posterizarr is a PowerShell script with a Web UI that automates the creation of textless posters for media libraries in Plex, Jellyfin, and Emby. It fetches artwork from various sources, applies custom overlays and text, and integrates with other media server tools.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ Web-Navigator | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automating web browsing and scraping tasks to improve productivity and save time.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Web browsing automation â€¢ Web scraping â€¢ Dynamic content interaction â€¢ Intelligent web searching â€¢ File downloading
ðŸ“– Summary: Web-Navigator is a Python-based web browsing and scraping agent. It leverages LLMs and the Playwright framework to automate web tasks such as navigation, content interaction, searching, and file downloading. The agent is designed to adapt to dynamic web pages and streamline complex workflows.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ flycut-caption | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Creating and editing video subtitles using AI-powered speech recognition and visual editing tools.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Intelligent Speech Recognition â€¢ Visual Subtitle Editing â€¢ Real-time Video Preview â€¢ Multi-format Export â€¢ Subtitle Style Customization
ðŸ“– Summary: FlyCut Caption is a React component for video subtitle editing, leveraging AI-powered speech recognition. It offers features like visual subtitle editing, real-time video preview, multi-format export, and subtitle style customization, making it a comprehensive tool for creating and editing video subtitles.

ðŸš€ nginx-ignition | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Simplifying nginx configuration management through a user-friendly interface.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Multiple nginx virtual hosts with customized domains, routes, and bindings â€¢ Multiple nginx streams with domain-based routing, circuit breakers, and weights â€¢ Host route options: proxy, redirection, custom code execution (JavaScript/Lua), static response, or static file serving
ðŸ“– Summary: nginx-ignition is a user interface for the nginx web server, designed for developers and enthusiasts who prefer managing nginx configurations through a GUI rather than manually editing configuration files. It offers features like virtual host management, stream configuration, SSL certificate handling, user access control, and integrations with Docker and Tailscale.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ flat | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Providing client-side applications (Web, Windows, macOS) for an open-source online classroom environment.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Real-time interaction (whiteboard, RTC, RTM) â€¢ Login via GitHub and WeChat â€¢ Classroom management (join, create, schedule classrooms, periodic rooms) â€¢ Classroom recording and replaying (whiteboard, cloud recording, messaging)
ðŸ“– Summary: The 'flat' repository provides the Web, Windows, and macOS client for Agora Flat, an open-source classroom platform. It offers features like real-time interaction (whiteboard, RTC, RTM), login via GitHub and WeChat, classroom management, recording/replaying capabilities, cloud storage, and screen sharing.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ chrome-devtools-mcp | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Enabling AI coding assistants to interact with and control a Chrome browser for automation, debugging, and performance analysis.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Get performance insights using Chrome DevTools to record traces and extract actionable performance insights.
ðŸ“– Summary: The `chrome-devtools-mcp` repository provides a Model-Context-Protocol (MCP) server that allows coding agents (like Gemini, Claude, Cursor, or Copilot) to control and inspect a live Chrome browser. It leverages Chrome DevTools and Puppeteer for reliable automation, in-depth debugging, and performance analysis within the browser environment.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
